meanings.definition: Cause (an effect or state) to happen again.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise reinduced her fear of thunderstorms.
meanings.sent2: The smell of fresh cookies reinduced memories of baking with her grandmother.
meanings.sent3: The magician reinduced the rabbit out of the hat for an encore performance.
meanings.sent4: The familiar melody reinduced a flood of emotions from his past.
meanings.sent5: The therapist used music to reinduce calmness in her patient.

meanings.definition: Bring about (a particular feeling or situation) again.
meanings.sent1: The movie reinduced a sense of nostalgia for the good old days.
meanings.sent2: The familiar scent of pine trees reinduced memories of camping trips.
meanings.sent3: The comedian reinduced laughter with his hilarious jokes.
meanings.sent4: The old photograph reinduced a wave of bittersweet emotions.
meanings.sent5: The familiar taste of homemade apple pie reinduced feelings of comfort and warmth.

meanings.definition: Restore (a person or animal) to a state of consciousness.
meanings.sent1: The doctor reinduced the patient after surgery.
meanings.sent2: The veterinarian reinduced the sedated cat to wakefulness.
meanings.sent3: The hypnotist reinduced the volunteer to wake up from the trance.
meanings.sent4: The lifeguard reinduced the swimmer back to consciousness after a near-drowning.
meanings.sent5: The smelling salts reinduced the boxer to alertness after being knocked out.
